DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study compare efficacy graded activity program supervise exercise pain , functional disability , quality life , global perceive effect , return work , physical activity , physical capacity strength lower limb patient chronic non-specific low back pain
DOC.brief_title: Graded Activity Versus Supervised Exercises Patients With Chronic Non-specific Low Back Pain
DOC.detailed_description: Objective : To contrast efficacy graded activity program supervise exercise pain , functional disability , quality life , global perceive effect , return work , physical activity , physical capacity strength lower limb patient chronic non-specific low back pain Design : Sixty-six randomized two group namely : Graded Activity program ( GA ) ( n = 33 ) supervise exercise ( SE ) ( n = 33 ) . The primary clinical outcome pain , assess numerical pain scale McGill Pain Questionnaire , disability assess Roland Morris Disability Questionnaire . Secondary outcomes measure Global Perceived Effect , quality life , return work , physical activity , functional capacity strength low limb . The program last 6 week , session happen twice week , duration one hour . Evaluations perform ( baseline ) , ( 6weeks ) follow-up 3 6 month treatment . Data collect blind examiner also make allocation patient group . Significance level establish 5 % .
DOC.criteria: Patients nonspecific chronic low back pain least three month , age 18 65 year gender minimum pain intensity score three 11point Pain Numerical Rating Scale ( range 0 10 point ) . Known suspect serious spinal pathology ( fracture , tumor , inflammatory infective disease spine ) ; Nerve root compromise ; Comorbid health condition would prevent active participation exercise program ; Pregnancy ; Cardio Respiratory illnesses ;
